form.name: introducing_complementary_foods_at_6_months_two
form.page_subtitle: CWC Counselling: Feeding A Healthy Child > Introducing Complementary Foods At 6 Months TWO

field.name: When giving complementary foods, consider the following:
Frequency: feed your child complementary foods 2 times a day
Amount: give 2 – 3 tablespoonfuls at each feed
Thickness: should be thick enough to be fed by hand
Variety: begin with staples foods like porridge (such as corn, wheat, rice, millet, potatoes, sorghum), mashed banana or mashed potato
Child may need time to get use to eating foods other than breastmilk
Be patient and actively encourage your child to eat
Do not force your child to eat
Use a separate plate to feed child to make sure he or she eat all the food
